documentation.text:
The Cortex contract is designed to be a bare bones, minimalistic approach to a versitile DAO structure. The Cortex is designed as
the control center that Allows a DAO to work with neuron contracts and contracts outside of the zer0 ecosystem.*

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Caller is not an approved Delegat address"

arguments.value: Caller is not an approved Delegat address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Caller is not an approved Delegat address"

documentation.text: @notice onlyApprovedDelegator is a modifier that prevents an unapproved address from calling the delegateFunctionCall function
fallback function so this contract can receive ETH

@notice addDelegate allows the owner of this contract to add a contract to the approved delegate list
@param _delegate is the address of the contract being added to the list*

@notice removeDelegate allows the owner of this contract to add a contract to the approved delegate list
@param _delegate is the address of the contract being added to the list*

The Cortex contract is designed to be a bare bones, minimalistic approach to a versitile DAO structure. The Cortex is designed as
the control center that Allows a DAO to work with neuron contracts and contracts outside of the zer0 ecosystem.*

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Caller is not an approved Delegat address"

arguments.value: Caller is not an approved Delegat address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Caller is not an approved Delegat address"

documentation.text: @notice onlyApprovedDelegator is a modifier that prevents an unapproved address from calling the delegateFunctionCall function
fallback function so this contract can receive ETH

@notice addDelegate allows the owner of this contract to add a contract to the approved delegate list
@param _delegate is the address of the contract being added to the list*

@notice removeDelegate allows the owner of this contract to add a contract to the approved delegate list
@param _delegate is the address of the contract being added to the list*

params._delegate: is the address of the contract being added to the list*

constructor.details: this function automatically deploys a synaps for the DAO if the _synaps param is set to the 0x0 address

params._CortexCreator: is the address of the account that created the Cortex
params._daoName: is the name of the zDAO
params._hippocampus: is the address of the Hippocampus contract
params._isTransferable: is a bool representing whether or not a DAO's rep token can be transfered from one account to another*
params._synaps: is the address of an existing Synaps (or ERC20)
params._tokenName: is the name of the DAO's rep token(if applicable)
params._tokenSym: is the symbol of the DAO's rep token(if applicable)

params._CortexCreator: is the address of the CortexCreator OR the address to receive the first synaps token
params._bondingCurve: allows a bonding curve contract to own the created synaps
params._isRep: is a bool representing whether or not a synaps is used as reputation*
params._isTransferable: is a bool representing whether of not a synaps is transferable
params._tokenName: is the name of the DAO's rep token(if applicable)
params._tokenSym: is the symbol of the DAO's rep token(if applicable)

params._amount: is an eth amount to be passed from the Cortex in the function call(put zero if not applicable)
params._target: is the target address where the function will be called
params.call_data: is a bytes representation of the function the Cortex is calling and its input paramters*

params._amount: is an amount in ETH to be transfered along with the connectNeuron function on the neuron(this acts like a constructor function for the neuron)
params._neuronName: is the name of the neuron that is being installed on the Cortex
params.call_data: is the bytes data for calling the connectNeuron function on a neuron*

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._delegate: is the address of the contract being added to the list*

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferETH(address,uint256).details: this function is intended to be used with the proposal system*

params._amount: is the amount of tokens being minted
params._to: is the address tokens are being minted to

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addDelegate(address).notice: addDelegate allows the owner of this contract to add a contract to the approved delegate list

methods.constructor: the constructor function is fired only once during contract creation and is used to set up the Cortex contract and its first synaps if applicable

createSynaps(string,string,address,addre.notice: the createSynaps function allows a Cortex to create a new Synaps contract

delegateFunctionCall(address,uint256,byt.notice: delegateFunctionCall allows a neuron contract to make an arbitrary call from the Cortex

neuroGenesis(string,uint256,bytes).notice: neuroGenesis is used by the cortex to communicate with the Hippocampus inorder to create a new neuron instance for itself

removeDelegate(address).notice: removeDelegate allows the owner of this contract to add a contract to the approved delegate list

transferETH(address,uint256).notice: transferETH is used to easily transfer ETH from the cortex contract

userdoc.notice: The Cortex contract is designed to be a bare bones, minimalistic approach to a versitile DAO structure. The Cortex is designed as the control center that Allows a DAO to work with neuron contracts and contracts outside of the zer0 ecosystem.*
